required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 10, 2022
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Safety and Efficacy Evaluation of NanoLithium® NP03 in Patients With Mild-to-severe Alzheimer's Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective, Multicenter, First Part Randomized, Placebo-controlled, Parallel-group, Double-blind Period Followed by Open-label Trial Period to Evaluate Clinical Safety & Efficacy of NanoLithium® NP03 in Patients With Mild-to-severe Alzheimer's Disease: Proof-of-concept Study

brief_summary.textblock: This proof-of-concept study will assess safety, tolerance, and efficacy of NanoLithium® NP03 in patients with mild-to-severe Alzheimer's Disease (AD).

detailed_description.textblock:
This French Study is a prospective, multicenter, randomized (1:1), placebo-controlled, parallel-group, double-blind period followed by an open-label trial period to Evaluate Clinical Safety and Efficacy of NanoLithium® NP03 in Patients With Mild-to-severe Alzheimer's Disease.
Patients will be randomized into two treatment arms:
- NanoLithium® NP03 (N=34)
- Placebo (N=34)
The first phase will consist of a double blind 12-week -period, which will be followed by an open-label 36-week period for each arm.
A total of 18 clinical or phone call visits are scheduled during this study. During the follow-up, clinical, biological, electrophysiological, imaging assessments and questionnaires will be performed to determine the safety, efficacy, and disease-modifying effect of NanoLithium® NP03.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: A prospective, multicenter, with a first randomized, placebo-controlled, parallel-group, double-blind period followed by an open-label trial period to evaluate the clinical safety and efficacy of NanoLithium® NP03 in patients with mild-to-severe Alzheimer's disease: a proof-of-concept study.
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)
study_design_info.masking_description: Double-blind period followed by an open-label trial period. The double-blind will be maintained throughout the double-blind period treatment (except exceptional unblinding in emergency situations for reasons of patient safety).

primary_outcome.description: The change from baseline to end of double-blind period (W12) of the NPI-12 total score in the NanoLithium® NP03 arm and in the placebo arm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety of treatment - Adverse effects
secondary_outcome.description: The number and types of adverse effects during the study and causal role of the study treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety of treatment - Clinical assessments - associated pathologies
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the safety of NanoLithium® NP03 after 48 weeks of treatment based on common clinical assessment: associated pathologies: medical conditions start and end date or ongoing, currently treated or not, recorded from patients file.

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety of treatment - Clinical assessments - biochemistry - AST/ALT
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the safety of NanoLithium® NP03 after 48 weeks of treatment based on common biological tests assessment: Clinical laboratory evaluations: biochemistry: AST/ALT (UI/L)

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety of treatment - Clinical assessments - biochemistry - Creatinine
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the safety of NanoLithium® NP03 after 48 weeks of treatment based on common biological tests assessment: Clinical laboratory evaluations: biochemistry: Creatinine (mg/L or µmol/L)

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety of treatment - Clinical assessments - biochemistry - Glomerular filtration rate
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the safety of NanoLithium® NP03 after 48 weeks of treatment based on common biological tests assessment: Clinical laboratory evaluations: biochemistry: Glomerular filtration rate -Cockcroft or MDRD method - (ml/min/1,73m2)

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety of treatment - Clinical assessments - biochemistry - B9 vitamin
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the safety of NanoLithium® NP03 after 48 weeks of treatment based on common biological tests assessment: Clinical laboratory evaluations: biochemistry: B9 vitamin (µg/L or nmol/L)

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety of treatment - Clinical assessments - biochemistry - B12 vitamin
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the safety of NanoLithium® NP03 after 48 weeks of treatment based on common biological tests assessment: Clinical laboratory evaluations: biochemistry: B12 vitamin (ng/L or pmol/L)

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety of treatment - Clinical assessments - biochemistry - T3
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the safety of NanoLithium® NP03 after 48 weeks of treatment based on common biological tests assessment: Clinical laboratory evaluations: biochemistry: T3 (µg/L or nmol/L)

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety of treatment - Clinical assessments - biochemistry - T4
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the safety of NanoLithium® NP03 after 48 weeks of treatment based on common biological tests assessment: Clinical laboratory evaluations: biochemistry: T4 (µg/L or nmol/L)

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety of treatment - Clinical assessments - biochemistry - TSH
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the safety of NanoLithium® NP03 after 48 weeks of treatment based on common biological tests assessment: Clinical laboratory evaluations: biochemistry: TSH (mlU/L)

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety of treatment - Clinical assessments - Hematology
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the safety of NanoLithium® NP03 after 48 weeks of treatment based on common biological tests assessment: Clinical laboratory evaluations: hematology

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety of treatment - Clinical assessments - Lithium blood level
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the safety of NanoLithium® NP03 after 48 weeks of treatment based on common biological tests assessment: Clinical laboratory evaluations: lithium blood level

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety of treatment - Clinical assessments - Systolic and diastolic blood pressure
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the safety of NanoLithium® NP03 after 48 weeks of treatment based on common clinical assessment: Vital signs: Systolic and diastolic blood pressure (mm Hg)

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety of treatment - Clinical assessments - Pulse rate
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the safety of NanoLithium® NP03 after 48 weeks of treatment based on common clinical assessment: Vital signs: Pulse rate (beats per minute [bpm])

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety of treatment - Clinical assessments - ECG - PR
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the safety of NanoLithium® NP03 after 48 weeks of treatment based on common clinical assessment: Electrocardiogram (ECG): PR interval (msec)

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety of treatment - Clinical assessments - ECG - QRS
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the safety of NanoLithium® NP03 after 48 weeks of treatment based on common clinical assessment: Electrocardiogram (ECG): QRS interval (msec)

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety of treatment - Clinical assessments - ECG - QT
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the safety of NanoLithium® NP03 after 48 weeks of treatment based on common clinical assessment: Electrocardiogram (ECG): QT interval (msec)

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety of treatment - Clinical assessments - ECG - RR
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the safety of NanoLithium® NP03 after 48 weeks of treatment based on common clinical assessment: Electrocardiogram (ECG): RR interval (msec)

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety of treatment - Clinical assessments - ECG - QTcB
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the safety of NanoLithium® NP03 after 48 weeks of treatment based on common clinical assessment: Electrocardiogram (ECG): QTcB interval (msec)

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety of treatment - Clinical assessments - Weight
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the safety of NanoLithium® NP03 after 48 weeks of treatment based on common clinical assessment: General clinical examination: weight (in Kg)

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety of treatment - Clinical assessments - Height
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the safety of NanoLithium® NP03 after 48 weeks of treatment based on common clinical assessment: General clinical examination: height (in cm)

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety of treatment - Clinical assessments - BMI
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the safety of NanoLithium® NP03 after 48 weeks of treatment based on common clinical assessment: General clinical examination: body mass index (BMI) (weight and height will be combined to report BMI in kg/m^2)

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety of treatment - Clinical assessments - cognitive signs
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the safety of NanoLithium® NP03 after 48 weeks of treatment based on common neurological assessments: Neurological clinical examination: cognitive signs: questions asked to patients/caregiver to detect execution troubles, attention troubles, language, gnosic troubles, praxis, visuo-spacial troubles and temporo-spacial orientation

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety of treatment - Clinical assessments - focal neurological signs
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the safety of NanoLithium® NP03 after 48 weeks of treatment based on common neurological assessments: Neurological clinical examination: focal neurological signs: questions asked to patients/caregiver to detect extrapyramidal syndrome, pyramidal syndrome, cerebellar syndrome, frontal syndrome, hallucinations, dysautonomia, sensitive system and epilepsy

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety of treatment - Clinical assessments - motricity
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the safety of NanoLithium® NP03 after 48 weeks of treatment based on common neurological assessments: Neurological clinical examination: motricity: questions asked to patients/caregiver to detect muscular tonus, abnormal movements, reflex, walking troubles, falls, postural troubles, coordination, sphincter and trophic troubles

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of treatment_BPSD_NPI-C-IPA
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the BPSD at 12 and 48 weeks, change from baseline to week 12 and week 48 on the Neuropsychiatric Inventory - Clinician items mapped to International Psychogeriatric Association (NPI-C-IPA) scale (Units on a Scale).

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of treatment_BPSD_NPI-12
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the BPSD at 12 and 48 weeks, score of each item of the Neuropsychiatric Inventory (NPI-12) (Units on a Scale).

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of treatment_cognitive performances - MMSE Score
secondary_outcome.description: MMSE score (Units on a Scale).

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of treatment_cognitive performances - CDRS Score
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical Dementia Rating Scale (CDRS) score (Units on a Scale).

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of treatment_cognitive performances - ADL Score
secondary_outcome.description: Activity of Daily Living (ADL) score (Units on a Scale).

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of treatment_PET-FDG
secondary_outcome.description: Cerebral metabolic rate for glucose measured by Positron Emission Tomography-Fluorodeoxyglucose (PET-FDG).

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of treatment_Biomarkers_Peripheral biomarkers
secondary_outcome.description: Pathophysiological peripheral biomarkers (amyloid biomarkers, neurofilaments, Tau protein, BDNF) (pg/ml).

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of treatment_Biomarkers_Non-specific biomarkers
secondary_outcome.description: Non-specific biomarkers (inflammation cytokines).

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of treatment_Drug compliance
secondary_outcome.description: Drug compliance by assessing the number of buccal deposits.

arm_group.description: Description: Homogeneous yellow oily liquid. Dosage: One administration of 3 mL per day (1.8 mg/day) by depositing 1.5 mL in the gingivo-jugal groove of each cheek with the graduated pipette. Duration of treatment: Approximately one year (12 weeks for the double-blind period and 36 weeks for the subsequent open-label period).

Description: Homogeneous yellow oily liquid. Dosage: One administration of 3 mL per day (1.8 mg/day) by depositing 1.5 mL in the gingivo-jugal groove of each cheek with the graduated pipette. Duration of treatment: 12 weeks during the double-blind period.

intervention.description: One administration of 3 mL per day (1.8 mg/day) by depositing 1.5 mL in the gingivo-jugal groove of each cheek with the graduated pipette.
One administration of 3 mL per day (1.8 mg/day) by depositing 1.5 mL in the gingivo-jugal groove of each cheek with the graduated pipette.
